title: is it wrong as support to sell your support item after said support item is fully upgraded?
body:
logic is this: if support item has a poaching penalty even after the fact its established its full power wouldnt it be more efficent combat wise to buy pinks instead since they are gutting hardcore mages such as brand or zyra? it would be somewhat more efficent after say 5 min after final upgrade since hey the item isnt doing its job anymore of supplying you gold so you basically "fire" it.  would you get more from selling it and replacing it? powerwise ofc

i read the passive after its fully upgraded and was surprised its still has that nerf on it.

in this meta botlane's never been more important with the drake contesting, a ward on the drake will more often than not stop the enemy from doing the drake for another minute and a half, if you deep ward around the blue buff/gromp/wolves you'll be able to communicate to your team "yo enemy jg is botside gromp, probs ganking bot/mid" - 3 minutes + for your team on knowing where the enemy jg is, coz he's gonna clear wolves, blue, gromp, gank either mid or bot and you'll know about it in advance

if you have actual teammates you can usually coordinate a counter-gank based on what he's clearing

if he's doing gromp > blue > wolves he's going mid - all your jg has to do is get ready to countergank mid and free double

if he did wolves blue gromp he's going bot, free double/tripple 

all that came from your {{item:3340}} 

vision's especially powerful in the late game, one misstep from an enemy trying to side push lanes you can easily pick them off

vision's been consistently nerfed since s7 because riot released this shit's busted but it does require a degree of ability from your side

It used to be like that, but now no matter what you do there is not enough ward for true map control. Used to play with 15 ward Janna. Now that is when you any mistake the enemy makes can be abused. Sure it helps, but not enough.

In endgame when you are on full build it might worth trading the support item. If your team has hard push, then enemy has no choice, but fight. And you don't really need wards to roll down on mid.

You don't need to sell it, it is worth very little anyway.  You just need to prioritize the proper CS to not get the penalty (cannon minions, gromp, scuttles, and blue buff).   Taking your own team's blue is probably one scumbag step too far, though unless you are fed, carrying, and the other potential blue users are trashcans.  

Taking the enemy jg's gromp, blue, and wolves is ideal.  And scuttles is part of the vision game so it is fair game I would say.  However, you will still be _much_ more poor than any other role unless you are getting kill gold (not assist), so don't be afraid to KS.

Of course, if someone AFKs and you are in a 4v5, you should sell the item immediately.  As nice as the wards are, they are not gold and items, and you will be forced to clear waves.
